name: Brian Slate
title: Full Stack Developer & Technology Leader
summary: Experienced Full Stack Developer specializing in front-end (React) and back-end (Node.js) development, with expertise in AWS and Containerization. Skilled in creating scalable applications and writing clean, efficient code. Proven in tech stack selection, system modernization, and building CI/CD platforms. Strong leadership in guiding teams and implementing best practices.
additionalInfo: Skilled in clear and effective communication
Described by my peers as 'affable and gregarious'
Don't just call me a plant dad, my yard is a lush oasis
Fallen victim to many home DIY projects
A fan of graphic novels, and a devotee of sci-fi and fantasy in all forms
3D printing enthusiast (someone stop this guy from printing yet another planter)
Enthusiastic collector of unique and funky timepieces

responsibilities: Built Proof of Concept using React & Node w/Amplify and Twilio API to validate project's technical direction
Collaborated in the evaluation and selection of the tech stack, and played a key role in choosing a development partner to ensure future flexibility and scalability
Oversaw the development of the MVP, ensuring alignment with project goals and technical requirements
Provided ongoing technical and product advice, participated in alignment meetings, refined user experience, and collaborated on branding and documentation efforts
Built and deployed AWS Lambda microservices leveraging both SAM and SST
Architected and developed a CI/CD platform from the ground up using Jenkins and Github Actions, heavily backed by automated testing, resulting in increased deployment cadence and confidence
Enhanced application development consistency by adopting local Docker development environments and containerized deployments via ECS Fargate
Managed a team of 10+ members, overseeing hiring, onboarding, and training of developers and contractors in various time zones, while fostering an environment for career growth
Led the modernization of a monolithic PHP & React application, enhancing stability, performance and scalability
Excelled in diverse roles (Scrum Master, Engineering Manager, Software Developer, and DevOps/Platform Engineer), demonstrating flexibility and expertise across the development lifecycle
Streamlined team processes including onboarding, daily scrum meetings, development, code review, and QA & testing, significantly improving efficiency and team performance

employment.other-notes: Genesys acquired Interactive Intelligence in December of 2016
responsibilities: Designed and implemented a JSON schema-driven UI tool to install and configure integrations via the Genesys app Marketplace

Developed a complex UI in Angular for monitoring and managing on-premises Bridge Connectors, enabling remote control, status display, and configuration of data synchronization with systems like Active Directory and LDAP into Genesys cloud (Implemented a setup wizard and advanced UI features similar to AWS EC2's interface)
Migrated an aging Angular.js SPA in coffeescript to modern Angular and typescript using event-driven observable architecture
Built and managed the Admin UI portal in Angular, enabling dynamic configuration and integration for the company's services and software features
Developed and integrated tooling to support coordinated iFramed applications, empowering development teams to build/deploy independent apps autonomously
Participated in the transition process during the acquisition of Interactive Intelligence, ensuring a smooth integration of technologies and teams
Presented an experimental VR-based support app to over 2,000 attendees at the company keynote, introduced by the former Interactive Intelligence CEO

employment.other-notes: BlueTree Network was acquired by Providence St. Joseph Health in 2019.
responsibilities: Transformed a .NET webforms/MVC system into an elegant Ember.js SPA & REST API
Built a platform to expertly match healthcare facilities with elite Epic consultants for post-launch software implementation, streamlining the connection process
Led initial development team as CTO - acted as a technical bridge between founders and the development team
Assisted in white-labeling BlueTree's software platform for other organizations, such as United Way

employment.company: University of Wisconsin Department of Medicine
responsibilities: Built several research database systems for the UW Atherosclerosis Imaging Research Program using a LAMP stack
Created a comprehensive HR management portal using Ruby on Rails & SQL Server
Developed an in-house web-based Query Manager tool allowing researchers self-service access to warehoused data
Built tools to quickly scaffold applications to meet department needs
Migrated and developed two public-facing departmental websites using Drupal
